description: 共同科英文（一）課程為一學年課程，每學期兩學分，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 增進學生英語溝通表達能力
透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神
透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野
透過課堂討論培養批判精神
提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**Course Description:**

This course aims to improve students’ English proficiency, critical thinking ability, and intercultural awareness. Students will participate in a variety of activities both inside and outside of classroom to polish their language skills. Moreover, they will enhance their critical thinking ability by conducting quality talk discussions based on the readings. Finally, their intercultural awareness will be promoted via conducting presentations on multiculturalism.

**Textbook**:

Daise, D., & Norloff, C. (2015). _Q: Skills for Success: Reading and Writing, Level 4(2nd ed.)._ New York: Oxford University Press.

(ABOUT $ 553; Available at 師大書苑; 02-83695556~7;台北市和平東路1段182-3號2樓;中華電信2F)

**Articles for required reading:**

Unit 1, Reading 1: We All Need a Role Model

Unit 2, Reading 1: So Much Dead Space

Unit 3, Reading 1: The Good Teen

Unit 4, Reading 1: Two Styles of Writing

**Grading Policy:**

Attendance & Participation                                                   15%

Reading Journals\*4                                                                        15%

Presentations                                                                          10%

Lab Visit/Self-Learning:10 hours                                                 10%

Book Talk                                                                               10%

Midterm Exam (Lexile)                                                         10%

Final Exam                                                                             15%

E-Portfolio                                                                            15%

**Bonus points:** helper, active participation, full attendance, extra hours of lab visit/self-learning, etc.

**Guidelines for Presentations:**

**1\. Individual Presentation (Self-Introduction, 2-3 minutes):** The aim of this presentation is to let your classmates and I know you better. You may briefly introduce your family, hometown, senior high school, and/or hobbies first and then highlight your talent and the special aspect(s) about you via a PPT presentation. Please include an inspirational quotation as your motto at the end of the presentation. **Prin**t **out** a copy of your ppt (6 slides per page) and hand it in before your presentation. Please **upload** the ppt to Moodle and **set up** your PPT BEFORE the class starts on your presentation day.

**2\. Group Presentation (20 minutes):** The aims of this presentation are to increase your multicultural awareness as well as improve your ability to work with others. You will work with your group members to introduce either Thanksgiving or Christmas. You may introduce why and how people celebrate these holidays (stories, music, food, games, activities, etc.) and analyze the celebration from a critical point of view.
